message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with computer vision techniques for detecting and removing shadows, which is a common problem in image processing and object detection. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of geometry, physical properties, and textures in shadow detection, which suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.GR (Graphics) and cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper evaluates the performance of different methods using quantitative measures, which indicates a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes the use of tracking performance as an unbiased approach, which suggests a focus on statistical learning and decision making, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a possible sub-category as well.
